intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium trilegionense, commonly known as the three-legged hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Hieracium trilegionense is a perennial herb with hairy stems and basal leaves, adapted to withstand cold and harsh conditions.
